On 25 October 2017, IS West Africa militants attacked Nigerian army soldiers in Sasawa, killing 8, and injuring a number of others, and seizing vehicles, weapons, and ammunitions.
On 8 July 2017, IS West Africa militants attacked Nigerian army soldiers in Kamia in Yobe, killing 12 soldiers and seizing weapons and ammunitions.

On 28 April 2017, in the clashes between IS West Africa and the Nigerian soldiers in Faruq village in Yobe, two IS militants committed suicide attacks which led to the death of at least 15 Nigerian soldiers.
Police and soldiers clash in Damaturu after the latter was suspected of interfering with a police convoy earlier in the week. Three police, one soldier reported killed.

properties.notes: Two people were killed by Boko Haram during an invasion on Sasawa, Damaturu. The perpetrators had earlier on attacked a military base before raiding the community where the victims were killed. Causalities of the military attack are not known.

Around 23 December 2016, IS West Africa militants attacked and killed 4 Nigerian soldiers and seized two vehicles, weapons and ammunitions in Yobe.
Military forces ambush and clear the Boko Haram camps of Golgore (15/03) and Bulasari (16/03). During the operation 'a number' of Boko Haram were killed and soldier was injured.
Military forces ambush and clear the Boko Haram camps of Golgore (15/03) and Bulasari (16/03). During the operation 'a number' of Boko Haram were killed and soldier was injured.
A series of multiple, coordinated attacks during the morning hours in Damaturu, 18 dead. Boko Haram are the suspected perpetrators.
Seven dead (including the bomber) and many others injured when a child bomber with suspected links to Boko Haram targeted a Damaturu bus station on 25/08. Some sources report a twin blast.
Students blocks roads in Damaturu, protesting the sale of handouts by teachers, who insist students must buy them before passing examinations.
A Boko Haram suicide bomber targets a Damaturu market, 15 reported dead, 50 injured. It is believed the bomber was a 'mentally handicapped female.'
Three police and five members of Boko Haram are dead after the latter carried out a bomb attack on a police outpost in Damaturu.

A twelve year-old girl detonates a suicide pack at a Damaturu bus depot killing seven (some sources 8) in injuring 31. Boko Haram is believed to be involved.

properties.actor1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawati wal-Jihad
properties.notes: A suspected female Boko Haram suicide bomber attacked a bus station in Damaturu. At least 13 dead, 32 others injured.

properties.notes: Air Force jets bombed an Boko Haram location at Garin Itace, 20km south of Damaturu. Intelligence reported indicated Boko Haram was re-grouping at that point to launch an attack on Damaturu. Causalities of the operation not known.

properties.actor1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawati wal-Jihad
properties.notes: A suspected Boko Haram suicide bomber detonated an explosive at a World Cup watching centre. 'Several' people dead, plus wounded. Fourteen dead, 26 injured.
A labour group led a protest calling for an end of vulnerability of state schools from attacks from Boko Haram.

properties.actor1: Boko Haram - Jamaatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawati wal-Jihad
properties.notes: Boko Haram gunmen attack a vehicle along the Maiduguri-Damaturu highway, killing nine. Following the attack the perpetrators made off with the truck.
Defusal: Police intersect a would-be suicide bomber before he is able to detonate his ordinance.
